\begin{abstract}
Extensive equilibrium Monte Carlo simulations are performed for a 
three-dimensional Heisenberg spin glass with
the nearest-neighbor Gaussian coupling to investigate its
spin-glass and chiral-glass orderings. The occurrence of a
finite-temperature chiral-glass transition 
without the conventional spin-glass order is established.
Critical exponents characterizing the transition are
different from those of the standard Ising spin glass.
The calculated overlap distribution suggests the appearance of
a peculiar type of replica-symmetry breaking
in the chiral-glass ordered state.
\end{abstract}
